text: Opogona percnodes is a moth of the family Tineidae. It is found in India and Sri Lanka. The wingspan is 12–15 mm. The forewings are dark fuscous, with purplish-bronzy reflections. The hindwings are dark fuscous, faintly purplish- tinged.Meyrick, E. (1910).XXII. NOTES AND DESCRIPTIONS OF INDIAN MICRO- LEPIDOPTERA. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1910 Category:Opogona
title: Opogona percnodes
